dt: {bc}the fact or condition of being present {dx_def}see {dxt|present:3||}{/dx_def}
{bc}the part of space within one's immediate {d_link|vicinity|vicinity}
{bc}the neighborhood of one of superior especially royal rank
{bc}the actual person or thing that is present
{bc}something present of a visible or concrete nature
{bc}the bearing, {d_link|carriage|carriage}, or air of a person
{bc}something (such as a spirit) felt or believed to be present

quotes.t: Though because it is a seaside town, there are more people now that it's summer.  … As well, their {qword}presence{/qword} means that our few restaurants—dark through the snowy months—are open now, their lights burning merrily into the summer evenings.

The two authors suggest that war is better understood as a form of play than as a place of business, that Clausewitzian theory collapses into absurdity in the {qword}presence{/qword} of atomic weapons.
Bacteria sense their neighbors and respond to the {qword}presence{/qword} of others in the colony by exchanging small molecules and bits of proteins called peptides …

shortdef: the fact or condition of being present
the part of space within one's immediate vicinity
the neighborhood of one of superior especially royal rank

dt: {bc}self-control so maintained in an emergency or in an embarrassing situation that one can say or do the right thing

shortdef: self-control so maintained in an emergency or in an embarrassing situation that one can say or do the right thing

dt: {bc}the doctrine that Christ is actually present in the Eucharist

shortdef: the doctrine that Christ is actually present in the Eucharist

dt.t: He has a {it}commanding presence{/it} when he speaks.

dt: {bc}to come to a place to be with (a person, group, etc.)

dt.t: He finally decided to {it}grace{/it} us {it}with his presence{/it} 10 minutes after dinner started.
Will you be {it}gracing{/it} the meeting {it}with your presence{/it}?

shortdef: to come to a place to be with (a person, group, etc.) —usually used humorously
when someone is present : near someone

dt.t: Their daughter is shy {it}in the presence of{/it} strangers.

dt: {bc}to make people aware of one by gaining power or influence over them

dt.t: Women are {it}making their presence felt{/it} in the industry.
The Internet service is {it}making its presence known{/it} by doing a lot of advertising.

shortdef: to make people aware of one by gaining power or influence over them

dt: {bc}a quality that attracts attention in movies

shortdef: a quality that attracts attention in movies

dt: {bc}a quality that attracts attention on the stage

dt.t: an actor with a commanding {it}stage presence{/it}

shortdef: a quality that attracts attention on the stage
